definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: I do miss you, dear teacher.
sentences.chinese: 敬爱的老师，我真想念您。

sentences.english: What do you think concerning our beloved teacher's (H'ng Siew Lee) successful slimming plan?
sentences.chinese: 你对我们敬爱的老师瘦身计划成功有着怎样的看法？

sentences.english: They are respectable people who are liked and trusted intheir town.
sentences.chinese: 他们在家乡是受人们敬爱和信任的人。

sentences.english: Our beloved Premier Zhou Enlai is the outstanding representative of this area.
sentences.chinese: 我们敬爱的周恩来总理就是这方面的杰出代表。

sentences.english: God is worthy of our worship and love!
sentences.chinese: 上帝是值得我们崇拜和敬爱的。

sentences.english: The whole nation mourned the death of the beloved premier.
sentences.chinese: 全国哀悼敬爱的总理的逝世。

sentences.english: BELOVED OSHO, PLEASE TALK TO US ABOUT THE COOLNESS OF LOVE.
sentences.chinese: 敬爱的奥修，请给我们谈谈爱的清凉。

sentences.english: Dear Premier, I am a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 敬爱的总理，我是一名医生。

sentences.english: Jeany: Honey- I think you should quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 敬爱的，我觉得你要戒烟了。

sentences.english: Bless my respected teacher healthy body, the plum the whole country.
sentences.chinese: 祝福敬爱的老师身体健康，桃李满天下。

sentences.english: Dear My fellow teachers, "The boat big to Ren, Ma Jun, who is far Chi."
sentences.chinese: 敬爱的各位老师，“舟大者任重，马骏者远驰”。

sentences.english: Jang is the dear leader's brother-in-law.
sentences.chinese: 张成泽是敬爱领袖金正日的妹夫。

sentences.english: That famous scientist come a long way form Paris to Shanghai to see his respected teacher.
sentences.chinese: 科学家从巴黎远道来到上海，看望他最敬爱的老师。

sentences.english: I would probably say the same for our beloved Leslie Cheung.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会说和我们敬爱的张国荣一样。

sentences.english: The  beloved  novelist x put her lovely gloves above the stove.
sentences.chinese: 敬爱的小说家把她美丽的手套放在火炉上方。

sentences.english: Dear, your resposibility is to be beautiful, while mine is to make money and raise the family.
sentences.chinese: 敬爱的，你担任貌美如花，本人担任赚钱养家。

definition: to admire/to revere/to look up to
to love and respect/love and respect
to express/to present/to extend/to tender (greetings, thanks etc)
the utmost care (idiom); to look after sb in every possible way
to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
